title.narrative: North Eastern Region Power System Improvement Project

description.narrative: The proposed project development objective (PDO) is to increase the delivery of electricity at the boundaries of the power distribution network in the participating states in the North Eastern Region.

participating-org.narrative: Department of Economic Affairs, Ministry of Finance, Government of India
International Bank for Reconstruction and Development
International Bank for Reconstruction and Development

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Asset Transfer | Description :GoI to make its best efforts, and POWERGRID and the States PowerUtilities/Department to take all action required, to promptly transfer the ownership and maintenance of the assets created (fromPOWERGRID to the States Power Utilities/Departments) promptly after the commissioning of such assets. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Audit Reports | Description :POWERGRID to submit project financial statements for each fiscal year, audited byindependent auditors, within 9 months after the end of the fiscal year. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Civil Works Contracts | Description :POWERGRID to ensure that: (i) prior to commencing any civil works: (A) allnecessary governmental permits and clearances have been obtained and any conditions attached thereto have been fulfilled; and (B)all resettlement measures set forth in the applicable RAP have been fully executed (including full payment for land compensation orrelocation assistance); (ii) prior to commencing civil works on transmission lines, the respective CPTD plan has been agreed withthe Bank; and (iii) each contract for civil works includes the contractors obligation to comply with the relevant safeguarddocuments. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Grievance Redress Mechanism | Description :POWERGRID to make its best efforts to ensure that each participatingStates establishes within 3 months after effectiveness and thereafter operates throughout Project implementation a grievanceredressal mechanism for the handling of stakeholders complaints arising out of the Project implementation, as incorporated in thestate-specific ESPPF. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Implementation/Participation Agreement | Description :POWERGRID to carry out the Project in accordance with therespective Implementation/Participation Agreement entered with the each participating States, after ensuring that the participatingstate has established its respective State Project Coordination Unit; and that the respective state-specific Project ImplementationPlan (PIP) has been prepared. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Internal Audits | Description :POWERGRID to select and engage auditing consulting firm or auditing institute,within 6 months as of the effective date, to carry out semi-annual internal audits. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS
Finance Agreement :Project Documents | Description :POWERGRID to implement the Project in accordance with the state-specific PIPs.| Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Project Implementation Units | Description :POWERGRID to maintain: (i) a Central Project Implementation Unit(CPIU) for coordination, monitoring and evaluation of Project activities: and (ii) PMC Project Implementation Units (PPIUs) locatedin each participating State, for the day to day implementation of Project activities. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Project Steering Committee | Description : Government of India (GoI) to maintain a Project Steering Committeeheaded by Ministry of Power (MoP) and comprised of representatives of MoP and the participating States, to monitor progress in theimplementation of the Project, and coordinate with/provide guidance to POWERGRID in the carrying out of Project activities. |Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Safeguard Documents | Description :POWERGRID, the participating States and their respective PowerUtilities/Departments to carry out the Project in accordance with the state specific Environment and Social Policy and ProceduresFramework (ESPPFs), the Initial Environmental Assessment Reports (IEARs), the Compensatory Plan for Temporary Damages (CPTDs) andthe Tribal People Development Plans (TPDPs), as well as the Environment Management Plans (EMPs) and the Resettlement Action Plans(RAPs) prepared or to be prepared in accordance thereto upon the screening civil works for the transmission, substations and/ordistribution networks. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Safeguards Monitoring and Evaluation | Description :POWERGRID to: (i) maintain monitoring and evaluationprotocols and record keeping procedures to adequately supervise and assess implementation of/compliance with safeguard documents;(ii) provide quarterly safeguards reports and (ii) unless otherwise agreed with the Bank, engage independent consultants to carryout final environmental assessment reports (FEARs) within 120 days after completion of stage I clearance under the Forest(Conservation) Act or 6 months after contractors completion of the detailed survey for the final placement route/ alignment of atransmission line. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Technical Assistance/ Capacity Building | Description :POWERGRID to prepare, with each participating State, andthereafter implement the plans for capacity building and technical assistance for the respective states PowerUtilities/Departments,all in a manner and substance (including ToRs) agreed with the Bank. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS
